eu.wauz.wauzcore

Class WauzListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.WauzListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener

    public class WauzListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
    This is the class, where most Bukkit events are caught and modified to hold WauzCore data instead of normal Minecraft stuff.
    Author:
    Wauzmons

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WauzListener()

        public void onWorldEnter(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerChangedWorldEvent event)

      • onDamage

        public void onDamage(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent event)
        Handles damage calculation in MMORPG mode. Cancels out damage in hub, damage to pets or damage from cosmetic explosions. Prevents damaging players in non PvP areas and fall damage when gliding. Also updates the boss bar if one exists.
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
        DamageCalculator.attack(EntityDamageByEntityEvent), DamageCalculator.reflect(EntityDamageByEntityEvent), DamageCalculator.defend(EntityDamageEvent), DamageCalculator.removeDamageModifiers(EntityDamageEvent), WauzPlayerBossBar.updateBossBar(double)

      • onHeal

        public void onHeal(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityRegainHealthEvent event)
        Handles healing calculation in MMORPG mode. Also updates the boss bar if one exists.
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
        DamageCalculator.heal(EntityRegainHealthEvent), WauzPlayerBossBar.updateBossBar(double)

      • onKill

        public void onKill(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDeathEvent event)
        Handles the killing of entities in MMORPG mode. This handler focuses on effects like life leech caused by the player, not on the actual death or loot drops of the entity.
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
        DamageCalculator.kill(EntityDeathEvent), "Real" death event handler

      • onItemDamage

        public void onItemDamage(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerItemDamageEvent event)
        Prevents item damage in MMORPG mode. The equipment there has its own durability system.
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
        DurabilityCalculator

      • onMythicSpawn

        public void onMythicSpawn(io.lumine.xikage.mythicmobs.api.bukkit.events.MythicMobSpawnEvent event)
        Handles the spawn of a (mythic) mob. This includes the initialization of modifiers, loot and boss bars.
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
        MenacingMobsSpawner

      • onMythicDeath

        public void onMythicDeath(io.lumine.xikage.mythicmobs.api.bukkit.events.MythicMobDeathEvent event)
        Lets the mapper decide how to handle the death of a (mythic) mob. This includes exp rewards, pet deaths and modifier effects.
        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
        MobEventMapper.death(MythicMobDeathEvent)

      • onInventoryOpen

        public void onInventoryOpen(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryOpenEvent event)
        Logs what inventory the player opened. The original idea was to construct/dispose custom items in the players normal inventory. This cannot work because the crafting inventory is only opened on client side.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • onInventoryClose

        public void onInventoryClose(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryCloseEvent event)
        Logs what inventory the player closed. The original idea was to construct/dispose custom items in the players normal inventory. This cannot work because the crafting inventory is only opened on client side.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • onItemDrop

        public void onItemDrop(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerDropItemEvent event)

        Parameters:
        event -
        See Also:
